descript.abstract: This geographic data file presents polygon data for 249 "countries" (sovereign nations, dependencies, and other global areas) covering: population,: AIDS/HIV incidence and deaths; national Carbon Dioxide emissions values for 2004; Gross Domestic Product; and national Imports and Exports data. Population forecasts are provided for 2015 and 2025. Other data represent values collected between 1999 and 2007. A value of -99 is used to indicate No Data.
descript.purpose: The data are intended to be used to illustrate the creation of Cartograms and for thematic data displays at scales larger than 1:15 Million
descript.supplinf:
Source: Population Values and forecasts Unless otherwise noted, US Census Bureau, International Division, www.census.gov/ipc/www/. Source: GDP, Imports, Exports, AIDS Deaths, AIDS/HIV numbers Unless otherwise noted, the data are from the CIA Factbook 2007 (www.cia.gov/cia/publications/factbook). Most data were drawn from the online publication's rank ordered tables (updated February and March 2007). Data definitions likewise, unless otherwise noted, are taken directly from the "Notes and Definitions" section of CIA Factbook 2007. Source: Total Carbon Dioxide Emissions U.S. Energy Information Agency, International Energy Annual - 2004
Geographic note on China: The data presented for China do not include Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

Countries_2007 is freely reproducible and distributable with proper documentation and source attribution for the above purposes. Uses of a commercial nature, such as but not limited to inclusion in or promotion or redistribution through other software packages that are sold, require licensing from ESRI.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eadetcit:
FIPS _CNTRY Two letter code for the country or geographic entity. Source: US Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology.
GMI_CNTRY Three letter code for the country or geographic entity from Global Mapping International.
ISO_2DIGIT Two letter code for the country or geographic entity from the International Organization for Standardization.
ISO_3DIGIT Three letter code for the country or geographic entity from the International Organization for Standardization.
ISO_NUM Three number code for the country or geographic entity from the International Organization for Standardization.
CNTRY_NAME Country name in common use.
LONG_NAME Official country name.
ISOSHRTNAM Short name used by the International Organization for Standardization.
UNSHRTNAM Short name alias used by the United Nations.
LOCSHRTNAM Short name used locally.
LOCLNGNAM Long name used locally.
STATUS Official status as of 2007 including, UN member states, various territorial and dependency categories, and unique entities such as Antarctica.
SQKM Area in square kilometers using an equal area projection. Source: ESRI.
SQMI Area in square miles using an equal area projection. Source: ESRI.
POP2007 2007 midyear population estimate.
POP2015 2015 midyear population projection.
POP2025 2025 midyear population projection.
POP014_07 Population age 0-14, 2007
POP1564_07 Population age 15-64, 2007 (Generally seen as the working age population)
HIVAIDSTOT Number of people (adults and children) living with HIV/AIDS. Source: CIA Factbook, 2007
HIVAIDS_YR Year of estimate for HIV/AIDS population.
HIVDTH Number of people (adults and children) who died of AIDS. Source: CIA Factbook, 2007
HIVDTH_YR Year of estimate for AIDS deaths.
TOTCO2_2004 Million Metric Tonnes of Carbon Dioxide Emissions Source: U.S. Energy Information Agency, International Energy Annual - 2004. Values for Montenegro and Serbia are derived as proportions of combined EIA values for the former state, Serbia Montenegro using 2007 CIA Factbook values for Oil Consumption, by each country.
GDP_USD Gross Domestic Product (GDP) (purchasing power parity) in US dollars. This is the value of all final goods and services produced within a nation in a given year. A nation's GDP at purchasing power parity (PPP) exchange rates is the sum value of all goods and services produced in the country valued at prices prevailing in the United States. This is the measure most economists prefer when looking at per-capita welfare and when comparing living conditions or use of resources across countries. The measure is difficult to compute, as a US dollar value has to be assigned to all goods and services in the country regardless of whether these goods and services have a direct equivalent in the United States (for example, the value of an ox-cart or non-US military equipment); as a result, PPP estimates for some countries are based on a small and sometimes different set of goods and services. In addition, many countries do not formally participate in the World Bank's PPP project that calculates these measures, so the resulting GDP estimates for these countries may lack precision. For many developing countries, PPP-based GDP measures are multiples of the official exchange rate (OER) measure. The difference between the OER- and PPP-denominated GDP values for most of the wealthy industrialized countries is generally much smaller.
GDP_YR Year of estimate for GDP (purchasing power parity). IMPORT_USD Total merchandise imports in US dollars (on a c.i.f. [cost, insurance, and freight] or f.o.b. [free on board] basis). These figures are calculated on an exchange rate basis, i.e., not in purchasing power parity (PPP) terms.
IMPORT_YR Year of estimate of import valuation.
EXPORT_USD Total merchandise exports in US dollars (on a c.i.f. [cost, insurance, and freight] or f.o.b. [free on board] basis). These figures are calculated on an exchange rate basis, i.e., not in purchasing power parity (PPP) terms.
EXPORT_YR Year of estimate of export valuation.

cntorgp.cntorg: REQUIRED: The organization responsible for the metadata information.
cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.

cntaddr.addrtype: REQUIRED: The mailing and/or physical address for the organization or individual.
cntaddr.city: REQUIRED: The city of the address.
cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
